result.execSummary:
The defendant David Charles Deibert Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property fr. Person, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (24 pages) SENTENCING HEARING commencing July 24, 2014, received and filed.

Defendant David Charles Deibert in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant David Charles Deibert in custody.  Deann L. Heard, appearing for Jay Pucek,  appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 
COURT ADVISES the defendant he must provide a DNA sample if not previously provided and pay the DNA surcharge.  

As to Count 1:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  3 years, CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence, with Zero days credit -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  1 year  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -   2  years. 

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Absolute Sobriety
- No drugs without a valid prescription
- AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
- Random screens
- Court sets Restitution in the amount of $0
- No Contact Order with Melaina P.
- Anger Management evaluation and any recommended treatment
- Seek/Maintain employment
- Cognitive Behavior Therapy
- Job Vocational training
- Obtain GED/HSD
- Parenting counseling 
- No fine
- Pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges.  Failure to pay during the term of extended supervision a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.  

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay the surcharge - if not already done
-  DOC to collect those monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of funds.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.  Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement received and filed.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Clerk:  jms
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Plea hearing proceeds.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms.  Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.  Defense counsel requested an adjournment for sentencing; no objection by the State.

Defendant David Charles Deibert in court with attorney Jamie F Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant David Charles Deibert in custody.  Jay R Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended  Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

/submitted by the State, charging defendant as follows:
Theft From Person, a Class G Felony, contrary to Wis. Stats. section 943.20(1)(a) and (3)(e).

Attorney Jamie F Cimpl-Wiemer in court, defendant David Charles Deibert not in court, in custody.  Jay R Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant David Charles Deibert in court with attorney Jamie F Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant David Charles Deibert in custody.  Nathaniel Adamson for Jay R Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MELAINA P.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant David Charles Deibert in court with attorney Jamie F Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant David Charles Deibert in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MORONEY, Branch 20.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
